page.title: 14CRAMOND :Dunfermline College
page.content: continued This year there are about 350 students at the College. They wear purple and green professional clothes. First-year students have to live in College in well-equipped single study bedrooms in the Tower Blocks whose names perpetuate the time the College was in Aberdeen. The College was first built in Dunfermline in the 1920s as a Health College for men and women. The Cramond buildings date from 1964. There were draining problems on the grounds so rafters had to be put under the building. The flat roofs and the window frames are difficult to maintain. There is a night security guard so there is little vandalism but the public, especially young boys, often try to use the playing fields. The Scottish Education Board owns the College.
